dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so 11/11 is almost here, you know, Singles Day?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so eleven over eleven is almost here, you know, Singles Day?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the biggest shopping event, like, in the world, right? China's massive one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the biggest shopping event, like, in the world, right? China's massive one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has become by far and away the largest shopping event in the world, raking in just over $30 billion in gross merchandise volume last year

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Started by Alibaba back in, uh, 2009.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Started by Alibaba back in, uh, two thousand nine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Singles Day rose to prominence when Alibaba successfully launched its first shopping festival on that day in 2009;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it's just exploded since then. I mean, from what, 27 brands to over 200,000 now? Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's just exploded since then. I mean, from what, twenty seven brands to over two hundred thousand now? Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the event boasts over 200,000 participating brandsup from 60,000 in 2017 and just 27 in 2009.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally wild. Last year, they pulled in over $30 billion, and they're actually expecting it to hit like, $37 billion this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally wild. Last year, they pulled in over thirty billion dollars, and they're actually expecting it to hit like, thirty seven billion dollars this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: raking in just over $30 billion in gross merchandise volume last yearand sales are expected to hit $37 billion by that same metric this year, according to Forrester Forecasts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, that's huge! But the article also says it might be, um, smaller and less international this time around?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, that's huge! But the article also says it might be, um, smaller and less international this time around?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The e-commerce festival is expected to be bigger and more international than ever in 2019

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a bit of a contradiction. Alibaba's apparently decreasing the range of items, even removing a million new products.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a bit of a contradiction. Alibaba's apparently decreasing the range of items, even removing a million new products.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba increasing the range of items on sale and adding 1 million new products on offer this year, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. And I guess fewer US retailers are getting involved, too, though you've still got like, Apple and Estee Lauder.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. And I guess fewer U S retailers are getting involved, too, though you've still got like, Apple and Estee Lauder.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A larger number of U.S. retailersalmost 25%, according to Adobe, plan to get involved, including big names ranging from Apple to Estee Lauder

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Right, but here's the thing: no Taylor Swift headlining, no Kim K fragrance launch. So, less star power, maybe?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but here's the thing: no Taylor Swift headlining, no Kim K fragrance launch. So, less star power, maybe?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taylor Swift is set to perform as the headliner in the opening gala this year, while Kim Kardashian did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for the shopping festival.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's really interesting. So, they're scaling back some of the flash, but trying to focus more on the "experience," you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's really interesting. So, they're scaling back some of the flash, but trying to focus more on the experience, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like gamification and, uh, celebrity endorsements are still big.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like gamification and, uh, celebrity endorsements are still big.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Experience is becoming widely seen as one of the keys to the festivals success, for example through celebrity endorsement and the gamification of the Alibaba platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And this is the first year without Jack Ma at the helm, which is kind of a big deal for Alibaba.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is the first year without Jack Ma at the helm, which is kind of a big deal for Alibaba.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2019 will be Alibabas first year organizing 11/11 without founder Jack Ma at the helm, after Chinas richest man stepped down from his position as chairman in September.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. The president of Taobao called it the "SuperBowl for brands."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. The president of Taobao called it the SuperBowl for brands.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Think of 11/11 as the SuperBowl for brands, Jiang Fan, president of Alibabas Taobao and Tmall businesses, told CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, still a huge platform then. And, get this, 80% of Chinese shoppers actually plan to buy American goods during it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, still a huge platform then. And, get this, eighty percent of Chinese shoppers actually plan to buy American goods during it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Almost 80% of Chinese shoppers said that they plan to boycott American goods during Singles Day, according to a recent survey from AlixPartners

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. Despite the trade war, AlixPartners thinks it could actually be a positive for US brands.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. Despite the trade war, AlixPartners thinks it could actually be a positive for U S brands.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: AlixPartners, which predicts the U.S.-China trade war taking a toll on participating U.S. brands this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. So, a lot to watch for on 11/11, even if it feels a little different this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. So, a lot to watch for on eleven over eleven, even if it feels a little different this year.
